titleStmt.title: Von Ludwig Wittgenstein an George Edward Moore, [August ? 1930]
titleStmt.author: Wittgenstein, Ludwig

sourceDesc.p: Original bei Timothy Moore; Kopie im BA. Publiziert (Letters, S. 158; deutsch: Briefe, S. 180f.; Cambridge Letters, S. 247; WiC, S. 189).

list.item: 2007/06: Conversion from Folio Flat File to XML

div.p: Thanks for your letter. I'm sorry you have such trouble at home. These illnesses are a bl. nuisance. â€’ My work is getting on moderately well but not more than that, I hardly ever feel quite alive. The weather is tolerable though rather changeable. Desmond Lee, whom you know, came to Austria & stayd with my people near where I live for a few days. We talked about you & wondered whether you'ld like the place. And I almost think you would. I'm going to stay here as long as possible to get something done.
